Welcome to pretalx's documentation!

pretalx is an open source conference management tool – it allows you to create Calls for Participation, customize them, read and review submissions, choose your conference's talks, schedule them (on as many days and in as many rooms you need), and release versioned schedules. And it can do even more – check the features page for details.

We work a lot to make our documentation as up to date, usable and complete as possible. We want you to be able understand, use, run, and improve pretalx, but of course, this website will never be perfect, or even comprete. If ther eis anything unclear or specifically missing, we'd be happy if you'd let us know.

Documentation structure

Administrator docs

Find out how to install pretalx on your own server and how to maintain an installation of pretalx.
REST API

Documentation and reference of the RESTful API exposed by pretalx for interaction with external components.

Developer docs

Get information on how to contribute to pretalx itself and how to build plugins that interact with pretalx.
Table of contents

Detailled overview of everything contained in this documentation.

Useful links

pretalx.org is the central entrypoint to the project and also the home of the commercial hosting service.
GitHub repository

The open source repository contains all code relevant to the project, and some additional related projects within the same GitHub organization.

Project blog

Any relevant news about releases (and pretalx in general) will be presented in our blog.

Twitter
